publicOfferAgreement.title: PUBLIC OFFER AGREEMENT FOR THE PROVISION OF SOFTWARE SUPPLY SERVICES
publicOfferAgreement.1_1: 1.1. The individual entrepreneur AGAYEV MIRZULFI NAZAR OGLY (hereinafter referred to as the "Company") offers an indefinite number of individuals-visitors of the website https://anty-code.com/ (hereinafter referred to as the "Website") to enter into a Public Agreement (hereinafter referred to as the "Agreement") for the provision of software supply services (hereinafter referred to as the "Service").
publicOfferAgreement.1_1_1: 1.1.1. Visitor shall mean an individual who visits the website but is not a Customer of the Company;
publicOfferAgreement.1_2: 1.2. This Agreement is a contract of adhesion in accordance with Article 634 of the Civil Code of Ukraine, therefore, its terms and conditions are established only by the Company.
publicOfferAgreement.1_3: 1.3. The Visitor's consent to enter into the Agreement shall be a request to the Company for the provision of the Service through the communication channels specified on the Website (hereinafter referred to as the "Request"). After joining this Agreement, the Visitor shall become the Customer.
publicOfferAgreement.1_4: 1.4. If the Visitor does not agree with any of the terms and conditions of this Agreement, he/she may not apply to the Company with a request to provide services.
publicOfferAgreement.1_5: 1.5. Within the meaning of this Agreement, the software supply service (Code 77264000-3 DK 021:2015 Common Procurement Vocabulary) shall mean the provision of access to special software (hereinafter referred to as the "Software") to the Customer, which makes it possible to perform indirect requests to other network resources.
publicOfferAgreement.1_6: 1.6. The personal data of Visitors and Customer shall be processed by the Company in accordance with the Website Privacy Policy, which is drawn up in compliance with the requirements of the "Personal Data Protection" Act of Ukraine, the Model Procedure for the Processing of Personal Data of the Commissioner for Human Rights of the Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine and Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of individuals with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data (General Data Protection Regulation) (GDPR).
publicOfferAgreement.1_7: 1.7. The Company, Visitors and Customer shall be referred to collectively as the Parties and individually as a Party.
publicOfferAgreement.2_1: 2.1. The Company shall provide the Service based on the Customer's Request, which must contain information about the selected operator and tariff plan, and the payment of a one hundred percent deposit. The Company shall have 24 (twenty-four) hours to respond to the Request.
publicOfferAgreement.2_2: 2.2. The Company shall provide the Customer with the Service within 24 (twenty-four) hours after responding to the Request and confirming receipt of the remuneration.
publicOfferAgreement.2_3: 2.3. The Company shall provide the Customer with the Service in the manner and within the timeframe in accordance with the tariff selected and paid by the Customer.
publicOfferAgreement.3_1: 3.1. The amount of fee and the term of use of the Service shall be determined in accordance with the cost and duration of the tariffs available on the Website.
publicOfferAgreement.3_2: 3.2. The amount of fee shall be stated in US dollars and paid in hryvnia in accordance with the official exchange rate of the NBU against the US dollar on the day of payment of remuneration.
publicOfferAgreement.3_3: 3.3. The Customer shall pay the Company's remuneration in the form of a 100 (one hundred) percent deposit for the Service using the Internet acquiring system through the LiqPay platform (JSC CB "PRIVATBANK") to the Company's current account.
publicOfferAgreement.3_4: 3.4. To certify the fact of payment of the fee and provision of the Service, the Customer may receive an electronic receipt by entering his/her e-mail address in a special form provided by the LiqPay platform.
4_1_list: Receive fee for the services rendered in the manner and within the period specified in this Agreement;
Change the cost of tariffs and/or tariff plans unilaterally;

Suspend, block or prohibit the use of the Software provided by the Company to the Customer if the use of such Software leads or may lead to emergencies, violation of the security system or terms of service;

Suspend the provision of services in whole or in part if the load created by the computing power provided, as well as by incoming or outgoing Internet traffic, creates unacceptable conditions for the operation of the Company's technical facilities or affects the quality, including security, of the provision of services to other customers of the Company;
Terminate the provision of services during the term of this Agreement for the purpose of scheduled maintenance of communication facilities and other equipment used for their provision;
Terminate the provision of services during the term of this Agreement if the Customer has breached its obligations under this Agreement.
4_2_list: Provide services to the Clients in the manner and within the time period specified in this offer;
Process personal data of Visitors and Customers in accordance with the Website Privacy Policy.
4_3_list: Receive services in the manner and under the terms and conditions specified in this Agreement;
Contact the Company with a request to return the fee for poor quality services;
Try a free three (3) hour access to the Service, if the Company is able to provide it.
4_4_list: Pay fee to the Company in the manner and within the time period specified in this Agreement;
Use the services in accordance with this Agreement, the laws of Ukraine and not commit any of the following actions:
publishing or transferring any information, the dissemination of which is contrary to the laws of Ukraine and/or international law;
publishing, transferring or viewing pornographic materials;
email spam, as well as other types of spam;
brute force, carding, phishing, any kind of hacking;
using software for downloading via torrent clients;
using software for payment systems and online banking;
committing actions aimed at disrupting the normal functioning of elements of the Internet (computers, other equipment or software);

taking actions aimed at obtaining unauthorized access to an Internet resource (computer, other equipment or information resource), further use of such access, as well as destruction or modification of data on this resource.
publicOfferAgreement.5_1: 5.1. The support service is available from 10.00 am to 5.00 pm, Kyiv time.
publicOfferAgreement.5_2: 5.2. We accept requests from users through our Telegram account @zzaghaev. The Company shall have 24 (twenty-four) hours to respond to the Request.
publicOfferAgreement.5_3: 5.3. In case the Service is unavailable for more than 24 (twenty-four) hours per 1 (one) calendar month, the Company shall compensate you for costs in the amount of down time, for example: if the server is down for 48 hours, we shall compensate you for 48 hours.
publicOfferAgreement.6_1: 6.1. The Company grants the Customer a non-exclusive license to use the Software for the entire duration of the Agreement throughout the world from the moment the Customer agrees to enter into the Agreement.
publicOfferAgreement.6_2: 6.2. The Customer may use the Software in any way that does not contradict the second part of paragraph 2.4 of this offer;
publicOfferAgreement.6_3: 6.3. The cost of granting the right to use the Software shall be included in the fee.
publicOfferAgreement.6_4: 6.4. The Customer shall not grant other individuals and/or legal entities the right to use the Software under a sublicense.
6_5_list: The Company shall not have any exclusive property rights to the KYIVSTAR, VODAFONE and LIFECELL trademarks on the Website;
We do not mislead consumers by our actions or omissions;

The use of the trademarks "KYIVSTAR", "VODAFONE" and "LIFECELL" is lawful in accordance with part 4 of paragraph 6 of Article 16 of the "Protection of Rights to Marks for Goods and Services" Act of Ukraine.
publicOfferAgreement.7_1: 7.1. The Company shall not be held liable:
7_1_list: For the quality and uninterrupted functioning and availability of certain segments of the Internet supported by third parties;
For direct or indirect damage (including lost profits) caused to the Customer in connection with the use or non-use of the Services;
For the availability of information posted by the Customers for all segments of the Internet due to the peculiarities of the functioning of segments supported by third parties;
For the information posted by the Customer and the operability of software installed without the Company's participation.
For the performance and compatibility of software developed by the Customer or third parties;
For third parties' access to the Customer's confidential information, including credentials, which occurred through the Customer's fault, as well as for the consequences of such access;
For any damage of any kind incurred by the Customer due to the disclosure of his/her credentials;
For the accuracy of personal data provided by the Customer;
For the performance of third-party software;
For any arbitrary software failures or errors generated by the Software, as a result of which the Customer's Service was suspended or the Service was not provided in full;
For any arbitrary failures in the power grids supplying the hardware required for the Software to function and in the Internet connection;
The Company shall not be a defendant or a co-defendant if the Customer's actions causes financial, moral, or physical damage to third parties.
publicOfferAgreement.8_1: 8.1. The Parties shall be exempted from liability for non-fulfillment and/or improper fulfillment of obligations under this Agreement in the event of force majeure circumstances, such as adoption by the state authorities of regulations that significantly impede the fulfillment of the Agreement, earthquakes, floods, fires, typhoons, hurricanes, military actions, mass diseases (epidemics, epizootics), transportation restrictions, ban on trade operations with certain countries as a result of international sanctions, destruction of hardware and/or software through which the Company provides services, as well as in case of other similar circumstances that are beyond the reasonable control of the Parties (hereinafter referred to as the "Force Majeure").
publicOfferAgreement.8_2: 8.2. A Party affected by Force Majeure shall notify the other Party within five days from the date of occurrence of such circumstances.
publicOfferAgreement.8_3: 8.3. In the event of Force Majeure, the term for the Parties to fulfill their obligations under this Agreement shall be extended proportionally for a period equal to the duration of such Force Majeure event and/or its consequences.
publicOfferAgreement.8_4: 8.4. A Party referring to Force Majeure shall provide a document issued by a competent state authority or the relevant chamber of commerce or its branch to prove such an effect.
publicOfferAgreement.8_4_1: 8.4.1. If the Company refers to the destruction of hardware and/or software, it shall not provide documentary evidence of this.
publicOfferAgreement.9_1: 9.1. The Agreement shall enter into force from the moment of the Visitor's accession to this Agreement and shall continue until termination of the Agreement by one of the Parties.
publicOfferAgreement.9_2: 9.2. The Parties may terminate the Agreement by mutual consent.
publicOfferAgreement.9_3: 9.3. The Company may terminate the Agreement at its sole discretion by notifying the Customer 10 (ten) calendar days prior to the desired date of termination via the means of communication used by the Customer to contact the Company.
publicOfferAgreement.9_4: 9.4. The Customer may terminate the Agreement at will by notifying the Company 20 (twenty) calendar days prior to the desired date of termination via the means of communication used by the Customer to contact the Company.
publicOfferAgreement.9_5: 9.5. The Company reserves the right to modify this Agreement at any time and in any manner without prior notice and/or consent of the Visitors and Users. Any changes shall come into effect from the moment the effective date changes at the bottom of the page.
publicOfferAgreement.10_1: 10.1. The Parties may not transfer their rights and obligations arising from the entering into this Agreement to any Third Party.
publicOfferAgreement.10_2: 10.2. If one or more provisions of this Agreement are held to be void or invalid, the other provisions of this Agreement shall not be affected.
publicOfferAgreement.10_3: 10.3. This Agreement is executed in two counterparts (versions), in Ukrainian and English. In the event of any discrepancies in the interpretation of the provisions of this Agreement, the Ukrainian language version shall prevail.
publicOfferAgreement.10_4: 10.4. All terms used but not otherwise defined in this Agreement shall be interpreted in accordance with the laws of Ukraine and business practice.
publicOfferAgreement.11_1: SOLE PROPRIETOR AGAYEV MIRZULFI NAZAR OGLY,
publicOfferAgreement.11_2: Record number in the Unified Register of Legal Entities, Sole Proprietors and Non-Governmental Associations 2010350000000043982 dated 08.09.2021.
publicOfferAgreement.11_4: Address: 14 Liubotynskyi lane, Kharkiv, 61161, Kharkiv region, Ukraine

privacyPolicy.title: PRIVACY POLICY
privacyPolicy.main_1: This Privacy Policy (hereinafter referred to as the "Policy") is required to ensure that Customers and Visitors of the https://anty-code.com (hereinafter referred to as the "Website") know how their personal data is collected, stored, used, and secured.
privacyPolicy.main_2: We use special legal terminology in this Policy. To help you understand it, we define each term immediately after it is referred
privacyPolicy.1_1: 1.1. The owner and administrator of your personal data is the sole proprietor AGAYEV MIRZULFI NAZAR OGLY (hereinafter referred to as the "Company", "We", "Us"). Personal data owner shall mean an individual or legal entity that determines the purpose of personal data processing, establishes the composition of this data and the procedures for its processing, unless otherwise provided by law; Personal data controller shall mean an individual or legal entity who is authorized by the personal data owner or by law to process this data on behalf of the controller; Personal data shall mean information or a set of information about an individual that can be used to identify that individual.
privacyPolicy.1_2: 1.2. Customers and Site Visitors grant their consent to the processing of their personal data by filling out a special form when visiting the site. Customer shall mean an individual who uses the Company's Services; Visitor shall mean an individual who visits the Website but is not a Customer of the Company.
privacyPolicy.1_3: 1.3. Personal data (hereinafter referred to as the "Data") of Customers and Site Visitors is processed automatically.
privacyPolicy.1_3_second: Processing of personal data shall mean any action or set of actions, such as collection, registration, accumulation, storage, adaptation, modification, updating, use and dissemination (distribution, sale, transfer), depersonalization, destruction of personal data, including with the use of information (automated) systems.
privacyPolicy.1_4: 1.4. If the site contains links to other Internet resources and/or web pages, the procedure and processing of personal data shall be governed by the privacy policy or other document on the relevant Internet resource and/or web page.
privacyPolicy.1_5: 1.5. This Policy shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of Ukraine.
privacyPolicy.1_6: 1.6. If you do not consent to the processing of personal data, you cannot use the site, please leave it.
privacyPolicy.1_7: 1.7. The Company, Visitors and Customers are referred to collectively as the Parties and individually as a Party.
privacyPolicy.2_title: 2. COMPLIANCE WITH THE GENERAL DATA PROTECTION REGULATION
privacyPolicy.2_1: 2.1. The processing of personal data of Visitors and Customers located in the European Economic Area (EEA) is carried out in accordance with the provisions and rules of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of individuals with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data (General Data Protection Regulation) (hereinafter referred to as the "GDPR").
privacyPolicy.2_2: 2.2. We process Personal Data as the Controller as defined in the GDPR:
privacyPolicy.2_3: 2.3. The processing and transfer of Personal Data is carried out in accordance with the requirements set forth in the provisions and rules of the GDPR.
privacyPolicy.3_1: 3.1. The Company collects the following personal data:
3_1_1_list: Name of the account in the Telegram messenger;
Full name and date of birth (if they are specified in the address of the email or Telegram account);
Phone number (if it is specified in the description of the Telegram messenger account).
privacyPolicy.3_2: 3.2. The Company will also process any personal data voluntarily provided by Visitors or Customers.
privacyPolicy.3_3: 3.3. The Company does not process personal data of people under the age of 16 (sixteen). If you are under the age of 16, please skip to paragraph 10.1 and notify the Company so that we can delete your data.
privacyPolicy.4_1: 4.1. The company uses the following cookies:
privacyPolicy.4_2: 4.2. Cookies are pieces of information that are transferred to your computer's hard drive from a website. They are not computer programs, just small information files that allow websites to store and access information about Customers' search patterns.
privacyPolicy.4_3: 4.3. To delete cookies from your computer, you need to change your browser settings:
privacyPolicy.4_4: 4.4. To delete cookies from your mobile phone, you should read the instructions for your phone device.
privacyPolicy.4_5: 4.5. You can learn more about cookies at https://cookiedatabase.org/
privacyPolicy.5_1: 5.1. The personal data of Visitors and Customers obtained without the use of cookies is stored in a storage facility in Ukraine. The place of storage of personal data received by the Company through cookies is regulated by the relevant documents of the Third Parties on the processing of personal data.
privacyPolicy.5_2: 5.2. Personal data is stored for 2 (two) calendar years after the end of cooperation with the Company.
privacyPolicy.5_3: 5.3. To ensure the protection of personal data, the Company uses the following measures:
5_3_1_list: Within the Company, personal data is classified as information with limited access;
The data we receive is available only to authorized employees;
All employees who have access to personal data sign a non-disclosure agreement.
5_3_2_list: Personal data is stored in a storage protected by an access code.
privacyPolicy.5_4: 5.4. There is no 100% secure way to transfer data over the Internet or electronic storage. Therefore, we cannot guarantee their absolute security.
privacyPolicy.6_1: 6.1. The Company processes personal data for:
6_1_list: Quality control of the services provided;
Sending informational and commercial messages to Customers and Visitors;
Monitoring the work of the site.
privacyPolicy.6_2: 6.2. The company does not use automatic decision-making. The Company also does not use personal data of Visitors and Customers to automatically assess aspects of the subject's personality (profiling).
privacyPolicy.6_3: 6.3. The processing of personal data on racial or ethnic origin, political, religious or ideological beliefs, membership in political parties and trade unions, as well as data related to health or sexual life (special categories of data) is prohibited.
privacyPolicy.7: 7. The Company may transfer personal data of Visitors and Customers to:
privacyPolicy.7_1: 7.1. Facebook Pixel is a web analytics service of Facebook Inc. ATTN: Privacy Operations 1 601 Willow Road Menlo Park, CA 94025 USA - www.facebook.com - "Facebook") on our website. The Facebook Pixel allows us to track the behavior of Customers after they have been redirected to one of our websites after clicking on a Facebook ad. This process is used to evaluate the effectiveness of Facebook ads as part of statistical and market research and can help you optimize future ads. The data collected is anonymous to us, so we cannot obtain any information about the identity of the Customers. In addition, we do not provide Facebook with any personal data. In turn, Facebook stores and processes such data, so it is possible to link to the profile of this user, and Facebook may use such data for its advertising purposes in accordance with its Data Policy. If you are a Facebook member and do not want Facebook to collect data about you using the Facebook Pixel tool and link this data to the member's data stored by Facebook, you can opt-out of Facebook Pixel in your browser settings.
privacyPolicy.7_2: 7.2. LiqPay is a payment service of JSC CB "PRIVATBANK" (EDRPOU 14360570; Ukraine, 01001, Kyiv, 1 D Hrushevskoho Street, https://privatbank.ua), the processing of personal data is governed by the Privacy Policy of JSC CB "PRIVATBANK";
privacyPolicy.7_3: 7.3. Telegram Messenger LLP (71-75 Shelton Street Covent Garden London United Kingdom - https://telegram.org) is a cloud-based messenger that allows us to communicate with Customers regarding the provision of services. The data collected is anonymous to us, except for the data specified in paragraph 3.1.1. The processing of personal data is governed by the Privacy Policy of Telegram Messenger LLP.
privacyPolicy.7_4: 7.4. Chatra (Individual entrepreneur Olesyk Viacheslav Hennadiiovych, acting on the basis of the certificate of state registration dated 25.04.2012 as an individual entrepreneur of the Russian Federation Address: 199406, St. Petersburg, Gavanskaya St., bldg. 24, apt. 30 - https://chatra.com/ru/) is a messenger designed to be integrated into the website to facilitate communication between us and our Customers and/or Visitors. We do not personally transfer any personal data with Chatra, but if you send us data that is collected by this software, it is processed in accordance with the Personal Data Processing Policy.
privacyPolicy.7_5: 7.5. The Company shall disclose personal data of Visitors and Customers to third parties to the extent required:
7_5_list: - to comply with a government request, court order or relevant
- to prevent illegal use of the site;
- to help prevent or investigate fraud
privacyPolicy.8_1: 8.1. Visitors and Customers have the right:
8_1_list: To know about the sources of collection, location of their personal data, the purpose of their processing, location or place of residence of the owner or controller of personal data;
To know about the third parties to whom his or her personal data is transferred;

To receive a response on whether his/her personal data is processed no later than thirty calendar days from the date of receipt of the request, as well as to receive the content of such personal data;
To submit a reasoned request to the personal data controller with an objection to the processing of their personal data;
To submit a reasoned request to change or destroy their personal data by any owner and controller of personal data if this data is processed illegally or is unreliable;

To protect their personal data from unlawful processing and accidental loss, destruction, damage due to intentional concealment, failure to provide or untimely provision, as well as to protect against the provision of information that is inaccurate or discrediting the honor, dignity and personal goodwiill;
To lodge complaints about the processing of their personal data with the Authorized Person or in court;
To apply legal remedies in case of violation of personal data protection legislation;
To make reservations regarding the restriction of the right to process their personal data when giving consent;
To withdraw consent to the processing of personal data;
To know the mechanism of automatic processing of personal data;
To be protected against an automated decision that has legal consequences for them.
privacyPolicy.9_1: 9.1. The Company reserves the right to modify this Privacy Policy at any time and in any manner without prior notice and/or consent of the Visitors and Users. The modifications shall come into effect from the moment the effective date is modified at the bottom of the page.
privacyPolicy.9_2: 9.2. If any material changes are made to this Privacy Policy, we shall use our best efforts to notify you in advance by email or by posting a notice on our Website. When we make material changes to this Privacy Policy, we shall notify you by email prior to the change becoming effective and update the effective date at the bottom of this page.
privacyPolicy.10_1: 10.1. To get access to personal data, send a request for their deletion or addition, you can contact the Telegram account @zzaghaev.
privacyPolicy.11_1: SOLE PROPRIETOR AGAYEV MIRZULFI NAZAR OGLY,
